results.title: The Ancient Chinese
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Shows the earliest civilizations of China, including the traditions and legends of the Shangi, Chou, Han, T’ang and Sung dynasties and crucial events in the lives of Confucius, Huang Ti, Marco Polo and the Mongol conquerors Genghis Khan and his son Kublai Khan. Contemporary scenes in Peking’s Forbidden City, on a silk plantation and an artist practising calligraphy show the deep-rooted nature of Chinese traditions.

results.title: Ancient art in Norway
results.brief_description: A survey of Norwegian art from ancient times to the Christian era. From rock paintings of fish, animals, people, vegetation and ships we follow the development and influences on art forms both domestic and public. Fine examples from all areas and ages are shown.

results.title: Anatomy of violence
results.creator_credit: Peter F. Davis and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: This film presents several speeches on the relationship of violence to social reform. The speakers who took part in a Congress on the Dialectics of Liberation, held in London and sponsored by the Institute of Phenomenological Studies, include: Allen Ginsberg (poet), Paul Goodman (editor of “Liberation” magazine), Herbert Marcuse (Professor of Philosophy, University of California) and Stokely Carmichael (former Chairman Student Non-violent Co-ordinating Committee). and others. Following the speeches two social scientists evaluated the conference.

results.title: The Anatomy of the dogfish
results.brief_description: Dogfish anatomy and its functions shown by actual shots of living fish, detailed dissections and animated diagrams. Habits, external features, feeding, and alimentary canal (including teeth), circulatory system; respiration with reference to circulatory system and pharyngeal skeleton; the kidneys; reproductive organs, actuality and diagram details of fertilization, egg-case formation, egg laying and actuality, development of embryo; cranial nerves and their important connections with ampullae, eyes, ear and viscera; the skeleton as basis of muscular movement. Photography by Norman MacQueen.

results.title: Anatomy of a teenage marriage
results.brief_description: After five months of marriage, Dave and Vickie find that married life isn’t what they expected it to be. Suffering from boredom, frustration and problems of immaturity, they begin to realize that they must both make important changes to save their marriage. Second edition of “Marriage is a partnership”. No other credits available.

results.title: The Anatomy of a group
results.creator_credit: Russell Morash, Boston University and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Dynamics of leadership”.
Illustrates the structure of a group, the goals to be achieved during meetings, participation patterns, the quality of communication, group standards, and group procedures. Discusses the difference between a collection of individuals and a group, and the means of getting a new group off to a good start.

results.title: Anatomical models
results.brief_description: A study of the manufacture of anatomical models, and their use in demonstrating the position of various organs, bones and muscles in the body. Suitable for Upper Primary to Upper Secondary students. No other credits available.

results.title: Ananse's farm
results.creator_credit: John Ossei, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A fable from Ghana, animated on film by a young African film-maker studying with the National Film Board. Ananse is a spider with a heart full of concern over the enmity existing between his friends. Instead of mediating in a straightforward way, he devises a scheme using a little deception to bring his friends to amicable terms. The moral of this folktale from Ghana is that employing the wrong means to an end brings undesired consequences, no matter how right the motive.

results.title: Analysis by mass: an introduction to the mass spectrometer
results.creator_credit: Brian Kaufman, Michael Clarke and Associated Electrical Industries Film Unit
results.brief_description: Structure of atom and nucleus; definition of isotopes; principle of the mass spectograph, explained by a model in which balls of different masses are deflected by different amounts in a constant magnetic field. Construction of a mass spectrometer. Uses of mass spectrometry: to identify molecules, determine molecular structure, measure impurities, analyse gases in breath, radioactive dating of rocks.

results.title: Amy is a tiger
results.creator_credit: Keith Hall and Cameracraft Film Productions
results.brief_description: A promotional film for industrial development in Queensland. A Canadian, visiting Queensland to report on business prospects and industrialization, charters Amy, an elderly Tiger Moth, to take him to the industrially important areas of the State.
